content.description:
Important notice - changes to the questionnaire

Based on your feedback, we have restructured this survey to reduce the length of the questionnaire and improve its design.

list: The data from this survey is used widely to enable rapid response, and inform policy decisions, about issues impacting UK businesses and the economy. This includes topics relating to business resilience, financial performance, trade and your workforce.

Questions are updated regularly to reflect important topics impacting the business community, and as the economy changes, the survey will continue to be updated to measure the impact of new issues businesses face.
Some questions are repeated monthly to monitor changes over time.
Your response helps ensure your business, and businesses like yours, are represented.
View the latest publication produced from this survey

content.description: Thank you for participating in this important survey.
View the questions before you start the survey

list: Information should relate to sites in the UK. This includes England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland.
We will treat your information securely and confidentially.

This survey is refreshed every two weeks. To avoid losing data and to help us provide real-time information please submit by the return by date, or at the latest before the next fortnightly survey goes live.
You can save a copy of your answers at the end of this questionnaire using the ‘Download as PDF’ button.

content.description: This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.
This section asks for information on any changes to the business's turnover in the last two weeks and expectations for the next two weeks.
This section asks for information about the business's exporting activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about the business's importing activities and any related challenges.
This section asks for information about:

list: financial grants and schemes
cash reserves
debt obligations
insolvency

content.description: This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

list: percentage, for example, on furlough leave or working from home, or made redundant in the last two weeks
working from home
returning to the workplace

content.description: This section asks for information about current and future actions taken by businesses to reduce carbon emissions.

We are asking this to understand more about how the business community may, or may not be, working towards the UK Government's target of net zero carbon emissions, as part of the actions to address the issue of climate change.

blocks.title: Trading status of your business
blocks.description: This section asks for general information on the business's trading status.

questions.title: Which of the following statements best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s trading status?
questions.description:
You can interpret 'trading' as 'operating'.

Only select 'paused trading' if all trading or operations have temporarily stopped.

options.label: Currently partially trading
options.description: For example, trading with reduced hours or staff numbers

options.label: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks

options.label: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
options.value: Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks

questions.title: Where in the UK are your sites temporarily or permanently closed, if any?
questions.description:
You can interpret 'sites' as 'premises'.

Select all the regions where the majority of the business's sites are temporarily or permanently closed.

options.label: None of our sites are temporarily or permanently closed
options.value: None of our sites are temporarily or permanently closed

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
None of our sites are temporarily or permanently closed

blocks.title: Turnover
blocks.description: This section asks for information on any changes to the business's turnover in the last two weeks and expectations for the next two weeks.

questions.title: How does {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s turnover for the last two weeks, compare with normal expectations for this time of year?

content.description: Exclude:

list: change expected due to seasonal effects
change expected due to normal patterns of business activity

options.label: Turnover has increased by more than 50%
options.value: Turnover has increased by more than 50%

options.label: Turnover has increased by up to 20%
options.value: Turnover has increased by up to 20%

options.label: Turnover has decreased by up to 20%
options.value: Turnover has decreased by up to 20%

options.label: Turnover has decreased by more than 50%
options.value: Turnover has decreased by more than 50%

questions.title: What was the main reason for this change to your business's turnover in the last two weeks?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

questions.title: What are your expectations about turnover for the next two weeks?

options.label: Expect turnover to increase a little
options.value: Expect turnover to increase a little

options.label: Expect turnover to stay the same
options.value: Expect turnover to stay the same

options.label: Expect turnover to decrease a little
options.value: Expect turnover to decrease a little

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
None of our sites are temporarily or permanently closed

blocks.title: Exporting
blocks.description: This section asks for information about the business's exporting activities and any related challenges.

questions.title: Which of the following best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s exporting status?

options.label: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export
options.value: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export

options.label: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export
options.value: Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export

values: Never exported and do not have goods or services suitable for export
Never exported but have goods or services that could be developed for export

questions.title: Has your business exported goods or services in the last 12 months?

content.description: Include exporting services from your businesses in the UK to an individual or business located outside of the UK
This refers to skills and services that are provided by people, and are 'intangible'.
For example, your business may provide a service, such as legal or financial services, to a non-UK business.

questions.title: Have you changed where you have exported your goods or services to in the last two months?
Where has your business exported goods or services to in the last two weeks?

options.label: Not exported in the last two weeks
options.value: Not exported in the last two weeks

questions.title: How does your business's exporting in the last two weeks compare with normal expectations for this time of year?

options.label: Not been able to export in the last two weeks
options.value: Not been able to export in the last two weeks

questions.title: How does the cost of exporting in the last two weeks compare with normal expectations for this time of year?
How does the time spent on exporting in the last two weeks compare with normal expectations for this time of year?

options.label: Time spent has stayed the same
options.value: Time spent has stayed the same

questions.title: Have you experienced any of the following challenges with exporting goods or services in the last two weeks?

options.label: Additional paperwork
options.description: For example, conformity assessments, customs declarations, health and rules-of-origin certifications

options.label: Basing some staff in an EU member state to be allowed to work
options.value: Basing some staff in an EU member state to be allowed to work

options.label: Change in transportation costs
options.description: For example, freight rates

options.label: Closure of infrastructure used to export goods or services
options.value: Closure of infrastructure used to export goods or services
options.description: For example, ports or shipping-container storage facilities

options.label: Customs duties or levies
options.description: Including VAT and other taxes

options.label: Destination countries changing their border restrictions
options.value: Destination countries changing their border restrictions

options.label: Finding information on how to export
options.value: Finding information on how to export

options.label: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.value: Lack of hauliers to transport goods or lack of logistics equipment
options.description: For example, containers, warehouse capacity or wooden pallets

options.label: Reduced demand for products and services
options.value: Reduced demand for products and services

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border
options.description: For example, documentary or physical checks

options.label: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications
options.value: Work permit or visa restrictions, or lack of mutual recognition of professional qualifications

options.label: Did not experience any challenges with exporting
options.value: Did not experience any challenges with exporting

values: Did not experience any challenges with exporting

questions.title: What was the main cause of these exporting challenges?

options.label: End of the EU transition period
options.value: End of the EU transition period

options.label: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period
options.value: Coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic and the end of the EU transition period

questions.title: How much disruption to your business have these challenges caused?
Which of the following support options has your business benefitted from, to help with exporting challenges?

options.label: Finding new overseas contacts or customers
options.value: Finding new overseas contacts or customers

options.label: Information on exporting
options.description: For example, changes to requirements following the end of the EU transition period

values: Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading but intends to restart in the next two weeks
Paused trading and does not intend to restart in the next two weeks
None of our sites are temporarily or permanently closed

For example, your business may receive a service, such as research or construction, from a non-UK business.

options.value: Finding information on how to import

options.label: Time taken for checks at the border
options.value: Time taken for checks at the border

options.label: End of the EU transition period

questions.title: Which of the following best describes {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s use of the GB landbridge over the last 12 months?

content.description: This refers to any freight movement between the island of Ireland and mainland Europe which crosses through GB.

options.label: Stopped using the GB landbridge
options.description: For example, due to a change in business needs or the end of the transition period

blocks.title: Access to financial support
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about:

  • financial grants and schemes
  • cash reserves
  • debt obligations
  • insolvency

questions.title: Has {{ metadata['ru_name'] }} received any government-backed loans or finance agreements during the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic?

definitions.title: Examples of government-backed loans and finance agreements

list: COVID Corporate Financing Facility (CCFF)
Coronavirus Business Interruption Loan Scheme (CBILS or CLBILS)
Bounce Back Loan Scheme (BBLS)
Future Fund
Loans from devolved governments

questions.title: Has your business received payment from any of the following grants or schemes in the last month?

options.label: Additional Restrictions Grant
options.description: Grant funding for local councils to support businesses that are severely impacted by restrictions

options.label: Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS)
options.description: UK government scheme for furloughed employees

options.label: Kickstart Job Scheme for young people
options.value: Kickstart Job Scheme for young people
options.description: UK government subsidy to provide six-month work placements for 16-  to 24-year-olds on Universal Credit

options.label: Recovery Loan Scheme
options.description: UK government scheme to support access to finance as businesses recover from the disruption of COVID-19

options.label: Sector-specific grant
options.description: Grants for specific sectors such as the arts, entertainment, tourism, hospitality, retail, or fisheries provided by the UK or devolved governments

options.label: Small business grant
options.description: Grants specifically for small businesses provided by the UK or devolved governments

options.label: Super-deduction
options.description: A new capital allowance on qualifying plant and machinery investments

options.label: Not received any of these grants in the last month
options.value: Not received any of these grants in the last month

questions.title: How long do you think your business's cash reserves will last?
How much confidence does your business have that it will survive the next three months?
Over the last month, how did your business's debt repayments compare with turnover?

content.description: This is defined as all loans and bonds, both public and private, that are payable in the future.

options.label: Repayments were more than 100% of turnover
options.value: Repayments were more than 100% of turnover

options.label: Repayments were between 50% and 100% of turnover
options.value: Repayments were between 50% and 100% of turnover

options.label: Repayments were between 20% and 50% of turnover
options.value: Repayments were between 20% and 50% of turnover

options.label: Repayments were up to 20% of turnover
options.value: Repayments were up to 20% of turnover

questions.title: How much confidence does your business have that it will meet its current debt obligations?

options.label: Do not have any debt obligations
options.value: Do not have any debt obligations

questions.title: What is your business's risk of insolvency?

content.description: This is where a business cannot pay its debts when they are due or the business owes more than it owns.

questions.title: How has your business's risk of insolvency changed in the last two months?

blocks.title: Operational performance
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about your workforce such as the:

  • percentage, for example, on furlough leave or working from home, or made redundant in the last two weeks
  • working from home
  • returning to the workplace

questions.title: In the last two weeks, approximately what percentage of {{ metadata['ru_name'] }}'s workforce were:
questions.description:
Your answers need to add up to 100%.

If your workforce did not fall into any of the top five categories, enter '0', then use the 'Other' box at the bottom to bring the total to 100%.

Rough estimates are acceptable.

answers.label: On partial or full furlough leave
answers.description: Under the terms of the UK Government's Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS)

answers.label: Mainly working at the same place they were working before the pandemic
Mainly working from home, instead of where they were working before the pandemic
On sick leave or not working due to coronavirus (COVID-19) symptoms, self-isolation or quarantine

questions.title: Of those partially and fully furloughed, what percentage were fully furloughed in the last two weeks?
questions.description: 'Fully furloughed' refers to workers who are not working any of their normal hours and who you are claiming for under the Coronavirus Job Retention Scheme (CJRS). This scheme ended in September.

content.description: Exclude furloughed staff who are working some hours. These staff are considered 'partially furloughed'

definitions.title: How you might answer this question

content.description: If your answer to the previous question was that 80% of your workforce were on partial or full furlough leave, and all of these are on full furlough, then the answer would be 100%. If half of the 80% were on full furlough leave, and the other half partially furloughed, then the answer would be 50%.
A rough estimate is acceptable.

answers.label: Approximate percentage of furloughed staff who were 'fully furloughed'
Or select 'Not sure' if the percentage is not known or is too difficult to calculate

questions.title: Is your business using, or intending to use, increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?
Why is your business using, or intending to use, increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Ability to better match jobs to skills
options.value: Ability to better match jobs to skills

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK

options.label: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally
options.value: Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally

options.label: Reduced carbon emissions
options.description: For example, due to less travelling to the workplace

values: Ability to better match jobs to skills
Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool in the UK
Ability to recruit from a wider geographical pool internationally

questions.title: Why is your business not intending to use increased homeworking as a permanent business model going forward?

options.label: Concerns with integrating new starters into the workplace
options.value: Concerns with integrating new starters into the workplace

options.label: Reduced reliability and retention of staff
options.value: Reduced reliability and retention of staff

questions.title: When do you expect your workforce to return to their normal place of work?

options.label: Workforce already returned to their normal place of work
options.value: Workforce already returned to their normal place of work

options.label: Not expecting workforce to return to their normal place of work
options.value: Not expecting workforce to return to their normal place of work

values: Workforce already returned to their normal place of work
Not expecting workforce to return to their normal place of work

questions.title: What percentage of your workforce do you expect to return to their normal place of work in the time period you selected?

blocks.title: Net-zero carbon emissions
blocks.description:
This section asks for information about current and future actions taken by businesses to reduce carbon emissions.

We are asking this to understand more about how the business community may, or may not be, working towards the UK Government's target of net zero carbon emissions, as part of the actions to address the issue of climate change.

questions.title: Which of the following actions, if any, has your business taken to reduce its carbon emissions?

options.label: Adjusting heating and cooling systems
options.description: For example, temperature, timings and reducing number of rooms being heated or cooled

options.label: Installing your own renewable electricity or heating
options.value: Installing your own renewable electricity or heating

options.label: Introducing a cycle to work scheme
options.value: Introducing a cycle to work scheme

options.label: No actions have been taken to reduce emissions
options.value: No actions have been taken to reduce emissions

questions.title: Do any of the following prevent action being taken by your business to reduce its carbon emissions?

options.label: Implementing change is too costly for the business
options.value: Implementing change is too costly for the business

options.label: Implementing change is too costly for the customer
options.value: Implementing change is too costly for the customer

options.label: Lack of expertise to assess different options for change
options.value: Lack of expertise to assess different options for change

options.label: Lack of expertise to implement any changes
options.value: Lack of expertise to implement any changes

options.label: Payback on implementation takes too long
options.value: Payback on implementation takes too long
options.description: For example, the payback is longer than tolerated by the business for capital investment

options.label: Unsure of how to measure emission output
options.value: Unsure of how to measure emission output

questions.title: Have any of the following been used to assess the impact of climate change on your business's ability to operate?

content.description: Include the impact of climate change on supply chains

options.label: Assessment of demand for goods or services
options.value: Assessment of demand for goods or services

options.label: Assessment of finance, investments or insurance
options.value: Assessment of finance, investments or insurance

options.label: Resource efficiency assessment
options.description: For example, considering alternative energy sources

options.label: Technological assessment
options.description: For example, changes to plant, machinery and technology

questions.title: Please tell us anything else about your business's current situation relating to topics covered in this survey

content.description: You have nearly finished! Make sure you continue to the next page and select submit answers at the bottom.
